result.execSummary:
The defendant Erick James Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Erick James Gordon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Erick James Gordon was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Erick James Gordon was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erick James Gordon

defendant.name: Gordon, Erick James
defendant.address: 11815 S Cemetery Rd, Solon Springs, WI 54873

records.addlTxt: Partial bail refund. Applied to fine in 22CM106

11:33 AM Defendant Erick James Gordon in court.  Attorney Stephen Robert Zuber in court for Erick James Gordon.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates 22CF195 will be amended to a misdemeanor. Attorney Zuber indicates defendant will pleads to counts 2 and 3, 6 months I&S 1 year probation, concurrent, costs, DOC programming, no contact with victim in 22CM106. Count 1 will be dismissed. No contest pleas to citations. In 22CM106, recommend 2 days jail, 2 credit, costs.
Defendant pleads no contest on forfeiture citations. Court orders fines on forfeiture citations.
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 2 and 3 of 22CF195 and Count 1 in 22CM106. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea.  Court finds factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. All other remaining charges dismissed.
State indicates 3 days credit. 
Court orders on 22CF195, 6 months jail each count, concurrent I&S 1 year concurrent probation, with conditions of DOC programming, costs, no contact with Victim in 22CM106, 3 days jail, 3 credit, bail applied, 120 days to pay or pay plan.
In 22CM106, Court orders 2 days jail, 2 credit, time served, costs, 120 days or pay plan.
